page.title: 02A Village School in Harden
page.content: Education in Harden takes place in the First School, which was opened in 1877. An extension was added in 1971, doubling its size. There are 94 children on roll aged from 4 to 9, with a headmistress, 3 full-time teachers and 1 part-time and 9 ancilliaries. There is a P.T.A. which organises social and fund-raising events. Parents are also involved in various activities in school and are invited to Thursday morning assemblies. School trips, visits and holidays take place frequently alongside the usual school work. Often visitors come into school to broaden the children's education. We are lucky to have a hard area and a big field to play on.
